column4: How can I edit ~/.mplayer/config so that whenever I use mplayer it automatically uses the option -fs?
you can use an alias, it will mean mplayer ALWAYS uses the option
in ~/.bashrc    you can add     alias mplayer='mplayer -fs'
use ALT+F2
the parent process needs to be running for it's children to keep running
you can use:  cat vid1 vid2 > result
the audio will be out of sync and there is a command to make it straight again
The CAT command will put videos together and make one new big one? That seems nuts
bout to test it
or more gracefully: cat *avi | mencoder -oac copy -ovc copy -o myvideo.avi -cat *avi | mencoder -oac copy -ovc copy -o myvideo.avi -
cat *avi | mencoder -oac copy -ovc copy -o myvideo.avi -
will do it in one move :)
will that take care of any video formats I have the codecs for, not just avi's? (obiously change the .avi in your command)
I believe so, Have a search around to verify
You are amazing, thank you for the help, and thank you for the help you've given me before and the help I'm sure you are likely to give me in the future
maybe the opposite will happen too, makes the world go around
Well, if you ever need help wasting several hours on google looking for complicated solutions to simple problems, I'm your man! :)
